meanings.definition: Smaller in size or dimensions than is usual or standard.
meanings.sent1: The undersize shirt was too tight for him.
meanings.sent2: The undersize backpack barely fit all of her books.
meanings.sent3: The undersize puppy tried to play with the big dogs.
meanings.sent4: Her undersize garden produced an abundance of vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The undersize car struggled to carry all the passengers.

meanings.definition: To make or be smaller in size or dimensions than is usual or standard.
meanings.sent1: She had to undersize the dress to fit her daughter.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to undersize their products to reduce costs.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally undersized the cake, making it too small for the party.
meanings.sent4: The tailor undersized the pants, causing them to be too tight.
meanings.sent5: The architect had to undersize the building plans to meet the budget.
